data.title: ExxonMobil: Q3 EPS up 15%
data.description:
ExxonMobil has reported Q3 2025 earnings of $7.55bn, or $1.76 per share. Non-GAAP EPS rose nearly 15% sequentially to $1.88, exceeding the consensus.

"We achieved the highest EPS we have ever recorded in a similar oil price environment," said CEO Darren Woods, pointing to record production in Guyana and the Permian Basin.

ExxonMobil reported operating cash flow of $14.8bn and distributed $9.4bn to shareholders, including $4.2bn in dividends and $5.1bn in share repurchases, in line with announced plans.

Having exceeded $14bn in cumulative structural cost savings since 2019, including $2.2bn achieved in 2025, the oil and gas group says it is on track to achieve over $18bn by the end of 2030.

data.title: Chevron: Q3 EPS up 4%
data.description:
Chevron has reported adjusted net income of $3.63bn for Q3 2025, or $1.85 per share, EPS that is up nearly 4% over the previous quarter, exceeding analysts' expectations.

These results reflect record production, strong cash generation and sustained cash returns to shareholders, management said, adding that the integration of Hess is progressing well, unlocking synergies.

Compared to the same period in 2024, Chevron's production rose 27% in the US and 21% globally in Q3, reaching record levels, while its adjusted free cash flow increased over 50% to $7bn.

The energy group added that it distributed $6bn in cash to its shareholders during the past quarter, bringing the total distributed over the last three years to more than $78bn.

data.title: London stocks ease after recent rally; focus shifts to budget, Bank of England
Solidity confirmed, Intesa Sanpaolo meets ECB requirements
data.description:
(Alliance News) - Intesa Sanpaolo received the ECB's final decision on Friday on the capital requirements to be met from January 1, 2026, following the supervisory review and evaluation process known as SREP. The institution will have to maintain a consolidated Common Equity Tier 1 ratio of 9.97%, a level that takes into account both the minimum Pillar 1 capital requirement, set at 8%, and the additional Pillar 2 requirements introduced by the ECB, which bring the additional CET1 component to 0.93%.

Additional capital buffers designed to ensure stability and resilience are added to this threshold. The Capital Conservation Buffer at 2.5%, the O-SII Buffer for systemically important institutions at 1.25%, the countercyclical capital buffer at 0.34%, and the Systemic Risk Buffer at 0.45%.

Together, these requirements define the prudential framework within which the bank will have to operate in 2026, ensuring a solid capital base.

The figures updated as of September 30 confirm Intesa Sanpaolo's robustness. Net of EUR 5.3 billion in dividends accrued in the first nine months of the year and coupons on Additional Tier 1 issues for EUR 300 million, the consolidated CET1 ratio stands at 13.9%, while the Total Capital ratio reaches 19.3%.

Considering the pro forma effects, the CET1 ratio rises to 14.9% and the Total Capital ratio to 20.5%, levels significantly higher than the requirements set by the ECB.

Intesa Sanpaolo fell 1.6% to EUR5.61 per share on Friday.

By Maurizio Carta, Alliance News reporter

Comments and questions to redazione@alliancenews.com

Copyright 2025 Alliance News IS Italian Service Ltd. All rights reserved.

NSD Co., Ltd. authorizes a Buyback Plan.
data.description: The Board of Directors of NSD Co., Ltd. has authorized a buyback plan on October 31, 2025.

data.title: NSD Co., Ltd. announces an Equity Buyback for 650,000 shares, representing 0.85% for ¥2,000 million.
data.description:
NSD Co., Ltd. (TSE:9759) announces a share repurchase program. Under the program, the company will repurchase up to 650,000 shares, representing 0.85% of its issued share capital, for ¥2,000 million. The purpose of the program is to implement basic policy of shareholder returns.

The program will continue through February 28, 2026. As of September 30, 2025, the company had 76,503,272 issued shares (excluding treasury shares) and 9,496,728 treasury shares.

data.title: Chevron Corporation Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Chevron Corporation reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 48,169 million compared to USD 48,926 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 49,726 million compared to USD 50,669 million a year ago. Net income was USD 3,539 million compared to USD 4,487 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.83 compared to USD 2.49 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.82 compared to USD 2.48 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 138,645 million compared to USD 145,080 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 142,158 million compared to USD 150,566 million a year ago. Net income was USD 9,529 million compared to USD 14,422 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 5.29 compared to USD 7.91 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 5.27 compared to USD 7.88 a year ago.

data.title: Exxon Mobil Corporation Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Exxon Mobil Corporation reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 83,331 million compared to USD 87,792 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 85,294 million compared to USD 90,016 million a year ago. Net income was USD 7,548 million compared to USD 8,610 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.76 compared to USD 1.92 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.76 compared to USD 1.92 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 243,866 million compared to USD 258,189 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 249,930 million compared to USD 266,159 million a year ago. Net income was USD 22,343 million compared to USD 26,070 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 5.16 compared to USD 6.12 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 5.16 compared to USD 6.12 a year ago.

data.title: NVent Electric plc Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
nVent Electric plc reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 1,054 million compared to USD 782 million a year ago. Net income was USD 121.2 million compared to USD 105 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.74 compared to USD 0.47 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.73 compared to USD 0.47 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was USD 0.75 compared to USD 0.63 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was USD 0.74 compared to USD 0.62 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 2,826.4 million compared to USD 2,253.9 million a year ago. Net income was USD 591.4 million compared to USD 321.1 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.92 compared to USD 1.55 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.9 compared to USD 1.53 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was USD 3.63 compared to USD 1.94 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was USD 3.59 compared to USD 1.91 a year ago.

data.title: Church & Dwight raises annual forecasts on strong demand for daily essentials
Fed's Schmid: Inflation risks remain, economy still showing momentum
Lockheed Martin demonstrates autonomous piloting of Black Hawk by a non-aviator soldier
data.description:
Lockheed Martin announces a major breakthrough in aerial autonomy: for the first time, a US soldier with no pilot training planned and executed real missions aboard an Option Pilotable (OPV) Black Hawk helicopter equipped with MATRIX(TM) technology developed by its subsidiary Sikorsky.

During the Northern Strike 25-2 exercises, organized with DARPA and the Joint Personnel Recovery Agency, the soldier took complete control of the aircraft using a simple tablet, carrying out several logistics, precision parachuting, and medical evacuation missions.

The demonstrations confirmed the autonomous Black Hawk's ability to perform complex operations—external load transport, resupply, and medical recovery—without pilot intervention. According to Rich Benton, vice president of Sikorsky, this technology can transform the way the military conducts missions by reducing risks to personnel.

These results validate the potential of MATRIX technology to expand the use of autonomous helicopters in resupply and rescue missions in hostile environments.

data.title: Novartis: stock up again, with Morgan Stanley more optimistic
data.description:
Novartis was among the biggest gainers on the SMI on Friday on the Zurich Stock Exchange, with Morgan Stanley upgrading the stock from "equal weight" to "overweight," with a target price raised from 108 Swiss francs to 110 Swiss francs.

At noon, the pharmaceutical group's share price was up 0.3%, while the Swiss benchmark index was down 0.3%.

In a note released this morning, the broker justified its upgrade by citing the recent decline in the stock's value, despite the improvement in the laboratory's product portfolio mix and the prospect of the upcoming launch of Rhapsido, its new tablet for treating hives.

While we expect growth to remain modest in 2026, we anticipate an acceleration from 2027 onwards, the broker says, which also expects an optimistic investor day on November 20, again anticipating a favorable impact on the share price.

data.title: Stellantis Monitoring Nexperia Chip Shortage, CEO Says
AbbVie Lifts Profit Outlook as 3Q Sales Rise
data.description:
By Connor Hart


AbbVie raised its full-year adjusted earnings outlook, even though profit was pressured by increased expenses during the third quarter.

The North Chicago, Ill., drugmaker on Friday said it now expects adjusted earnings of $10.61 to $10.65 a share for the year, up from a prior outlook of $10.38 to $10.58 a share. Analysts surveyed by FactSet are looking for adjusted earnings of $10.51 a share.

The new outlook came as AbbVie posted a profit of $186 million, or 10 cents a share, for its three months ended Sept. 30, compared with $1.56 billion, or 88 cents a share, a year earlier.

Stripping out certain one-time items, earnings came in at $1.86 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet expected adjusted earnings of $1.77 a share.

Higher operating expenses weighed on the company's bottom line during the recent quarter, rising to $13.87 billion from $10.63 billion a year ago.

Revenue rose 9.1% to $15.78 billion, compared with Wall Street models for $15.59 billion.

Sales of AbbVie's immune-disease therapy Humira were down 55% globally, to $993 million, and declined even more steeply on a percentage basis in the U.S. The drug was previously AbbVie's top seller but now faces competition from cheaper copycats.

The decline was offset by sales of its newer arthritis drugs Skyrizi, which soared 47% globally to $4.71 billion, and Rinvoq, which logged a 35% gain to $2.18 billion.


Write to Connor Hart at connor.hart@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-31-25 0826ET

India's Patanjali Foods quarterly profit surges on strong edible oil demand
data.description:
(Reuters) -India's Patanjali Foods posted a 67.4% increase in quarterly profit on Friday, on strong demand for its edible oils.

The Sunrich edible oil maker's profit after tax rose to 5.17 billion rupees ($58.82 million) for the quarter ended September 30 from 3.09 billion rupees a year earlier.

Patanjali Foods benefited from a cut in import duty on crude edible oils to 10% from 20%.

The move, aimed at easing inflation and boosting domestic refining, reduced the cost of local processing and supported edible oil makers' margins.

Revenue from Patanjali's edible oils business, which makes up nearly 70% of the total, rose 17.2% during the quarter to 69.72 billion rupees.

The firm also reduced prices on select edible oils, including its ghee, to pass on benefits from a recent cut in goods and services tax to customers.

Larger rivals AWL Agri Business and Saffola owner Marico are yet to report results.

Overall revenue increased by 21% to 97.99 billion rupees.

Shares of Patanjali ended 1.2% lower ahead of the results on Friday.

($1 = 87.8950 Indian rupees)

(Reporting by Yagnoseni Das and Meenakshi Maidas in Bengaluru; Editing by Ronojoy Mazumdar)

data.title: Investors piled into equity funds ahead of Fed rate cut, US-China trade deal
US, Philippines form military task force for areas including South China Sea, Pentagon says
data.description:
(Reuters) -The United States and the Philippines have formed a new joint task force to strengthen cooperation and increase military readiness in areas including the South China Sea, the Pentagon said on Friday.

The announcement followed a meeting between Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth and Philippine Secretary of National Defense Gilberto Teodoro at a gathering of ASEAN defence ministers in the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur.

Task Force-Philippines "will increase operational cooperation, improve combined planning, and enhance interoperability, particularly in the South China Sea," according to a statement from Pentagon spokesman Sean Parnell.

In a meeting with his Chinese counterpart on Friday, Hegseth said he raised concern about China's actions towards Washington's regional allies and partners, in apparent references to repeated clashes with the Philippines in the South China Sea and tension with Australia over surveillance flights. Hegseth also said the U.S. was concerned about China's activities in the disputed South China Sea and around Taiwan.

The U.S. and Philippines defense secretaries "shared their determination to re-establish deterrence in the region" in their fourth meeting, the Pentagon said. The U.S. and Philippines have a mutual defense treaty.

They also announced the completion of a plan to modernize the defense partnership and speed up progress on major priorities over the next two years, the statement said.

(Reporting by Doina Chiacu. Editing by Mark Potter)

Canadian National Railway 3Q Profit, Revenue Rise
data.description:
By Adriano Marchese


Canadian National Railway reported a rise in third-quarter profit and revenue thanks to higher freight volumes transported.

The Canadian railroad on Friday posted higher net income of 1.14 billion Canadian dollars ($815 million), or C$1.83 a share, up from C$1.09 billion, or C$1.72 a share, in the comparable quarter a year earlier.

Adjusted earnings were C$1.83 a share, coming in ahead of the C$1.77 a share that analysts expected for the period, according to a FactSet poll.

Total revenue rose in the quarter, reaching C$4.17 billion from C$4.11 billion a year earlier, just ahead of Wall Street expectations of a rise to C$4.16 billion. Freight revenue rose to C$3.99 billion from C$3.92 billion.

CN Rail operates a nearly 20,000-mile rail network and related transportation services, connecting Canada's eastern and western coasts with the U.S. Midwest and the U.S. Gulf Coast.

On the operations side, gross ton miles increased 1% to 111.9 billion and revenue ton miles also rose 1% to 57.19 billion. GTM represents the total weight of a train multiplied by the distance traveled in miles, while RTM, a financial metric, is the weight of revenue-generating freight multiplied by the distance.

Operating ratio, which measures efficiency, was 61.4%, down by 170 basis points from a year earlier. In this metric, a lower ratio indicates better profitability.

For the year, Montreal-based CN Rail said it would keep its guidance unchanged, calling for mid- to high-single-digit adjusted earnings-per-share growth. It also said it continues to invest net of about C$3.35 billion in its capital program.


Write to Adriano Marchese at adriano.marchese@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-31-25 0820ET
